answers.answer: Hello.The symptoms of tingling, numbness, pain and burning are typical of neuropathy. These are less likely to be due to a cardiac problem.You should get a neurologist's consultation and get an MRI of the cervical spine. You will also have to rule out diabetes as a potential cause of neuropathy.Regards

question: The past few weeks my left foot will go numb for no reason. At night its really bad and during the daytime it is light. I also at times experince light tingling in my hand and fingers. Pain in my neck and upper back. Are all these tied into each other and should I be concerend about it being heart attack/stroke symptoms?
title: Numbness in foot and tingling in other places
